docs.lead_paragraph: Many analysts say the House bill is not as bad for business as many in the health care industry might have feared when the overhaul effort began.

headline.main: Obama Presses Senate to Pass Its Health Bill
headline.print_headline: OBAMA PRESSES SENATE TO PASS ITS HEALTH BILL

docs.snippet: The slim margin in the House suggests greater challenges in the Senate, where the majority leader, Harry Reid, is struggling to hold on to all 58 Democrats and two independents.

docs.lead_paragraph: Don't tell the House speaker, Nancy Pelosi, but that was supposed to be the easy part. The House on Saturday night approved the major health care legislation by a vote of 220 to 215, with a single Republican joining 219 Democrats in favor, while 39 Democrats sided with 176 Republicans in opposition.

headline.kicker: PRESCRIPTIONS MAKING SENSE OF THE HEALTH CARE DEBATE

docs.abstract: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi had to work a bit to win 220-215 vote in favor of health care legislation, but real challenge will be getting measure through Senate; Democrats have stronger majority in House than in Senate; Pelosi had much stronger control over floor proceedings than Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid can wield; Pelosi could afford to lose 39 House Democrats who voted against measure, but Reid will need votes of all 60 Senate Democrats to overcome Republican filibuster and bring measure before Senate for debate; photo (M)
docs.snippet: Don't tell the House speaker, Nancy Pelosi, but that was supposed to be the easy part.      The House on Saturday night approved the major health care legislation by a vote of 220 to 215, with a single Republican joining 219 Democrats in favor, while...

docs.lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Manmohan Singh pledged on Sunday to spend more on health care and education and make it easier for foreign investors to take part in India's $1.2 trillion economy. At a World Economic Forum meeting here, Mr. Singh said that public sector spending on health care would more than double, to 2.5 percent of gross domestic product, and education spending would increase to 6 percent. The government ''should have done a lot more in both areas'' in recent years, he said.
docs.abstract: Indian Prime Min Manmohan Singh pledges to encourage foreign investment in India and forecasts growth for nation's $1.2 trillion economy (S)

headline.main: If Anything, the Senate's Task Is Trickier

docs.abstract: If it was tough for the House speaker, Nancy Pelosi, to win passage of a health care bill, imagine the painful task in store for the Senate majority leader, Harry Reid, who needs the support of all 60 of his caucus members just to bring a health bill to floor.

headline.main: Obama's Statement on House Health Bill

docs.abstract: Text of President Obama's prepared remarks Sunday on House passage of the health care bill.
docs.snippet: Text of President Obama's prepared remarks Sunday on House passage of the health care bill.

docs.lead_paragraph: Late Saturday night the House passed a health care bill. The final vote, 220 to 215, was Democrats' attempt to answer what President Obama described as "the call of history" and marked the culmination of months of inter-party and intra-party squabbling, town hall meetings and tea parties, and 14 hours of passionate Saturday floor debate.

docs.abstract: The House passes a health care bill, with the vote of one Republican.
